meanings.definition: The process of sorting and prioritizing patients based on the severity of their condition.
meanings.sent1: During the triage, the nurse quickly assessed who needed help first.
meanings.sent2: In a busy emergency room, triage helps medical staff decide who to treat first.
meanings.sent3: The hospital's teddy bear triage was a fun way to teach kids about helping others.
meanings.sent4: In the chaos of the disaster, the team leader's triage of tasks saved the day.
meanings.sent5: The vivid image of triage in action stayed with the new medical student.

meanings.definition: To assign degrees of urgency to patients in a medical emergency.
meanings.sent1: The paramedic had to triage the injured quickly to save lives.
meanings.sent2: Doctors triage patients to make sure the most critical cases are seen first.
meanings.sent3: The nurse jokingly said she would triage her to-do list before tackling it.
meanings.sent4: In the ER, the staff had to triage the flood of patients pouring in.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to triage the student's questions to cover all the topics in class.

meanings.definition: The act of determining the order of treatment for a group of patients based on the severity of their condition.
meanings.sent1: The doctor's triage of the patients ensured those in critical condition were seen first.
meanings.sent2: Triage in a disaster zone is crucial to saving as many lives as possible.
meanings.sent3: The triage of desserts at the party led to the chocolate cake disappearing first.
meanings.sent4: Her triage of tasks at work helped her stay organized and efficient.
meanings.sent5: The vivid memory of the triage process stuck with the new EMT trainee.
